title: "internal compiler error: var types encountered in super_relate_consts" from const generic type with default

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I'm using const generics on a trait and a struct, with a default value on the struct's parameter. When the const parameter on the struct is omitted erroneously (the trait bound requires `N` to be specified), the compiler panics instead of catching the error. I would expect it to complain about mismatched generic parameters, correcting `wrong_const: Struct` to `wrong_const: Struct`. ### Code ```Rust const DEFAULT: usize = 0; trait Trait { } struct Struct; impl Struct { fn foo>(&self, _: T) { } } fn bar>(wrong_const: Struct, trait_usage: T) { wrong_const.foo(trait_usage) } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0-nightly (574b64a97 2022-12-31) binary: rustc commit-hash: 574b64a97f52162f965bc201e47f0af8279ca65d commit-date: 2022-12-31 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.68.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: /rustc/574b64a97f52162f965bc201e47f0af8279ca65d/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/relate.rs:638:13: var types encountered in super_relate_consts: Const { ty: usize, kind: Infer(Var(_#0c)) } Const { ty: usize, kind: Value(Leaf(0x0000000000000000)) } thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/574b64a97f52162f965bc201e47f0af8279ca65d/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1581:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f86259652ba -
